I love to support my country, people restaurants. I am sorry that I have to write such a not so nice review but that‚Äôs how you improve on your business and not lose support/customers. The chef needs to taste everything that is coming out because I waste a lot of money yesterday.

I never heard of this restaurant  before , I am happy that President Ali paid a  visit. I will definitely be coming in a few days to get my dinner. Just listening to the charsmisic owner air her points of concern ,speaks volume about her.  I urge all food lovers to patronize this restaurant.
Place was good before now they are just ok. Prices are high for small portions and they are very inconsistent. Better Guyanese food options out there especially in queens they are mid
Went with my mom and she loved the spinach rice with salmon. We also had beef patties. I‚Äôm a big fan of the bake with salt fish!

Restaurant owners really need to hire better cooks I bought some shark today and it wasn't seasoning at all especially shark food is not cheap but just like how you want to charge you need to literally cook it properly finally time is very cheap in broadleaf time is very cheap especially if you cooking shark needs to be seasoned properly com Don't mind paying for my food but it better taste good everything went to the garbage
I always liked it here. Good prices and very good foofd.
Getting better on all levels. Food and service.
Omg the food the paties just wonderful can't complain about any thing basically üòã
Delicious Caribbean delights. Enjoy the flavors and spices from the islands. Have that sunshine feeling in the middle of Brooklyn. Enjoy.

Cowheel soup was nasty should have waited until Linda‚Äôs had soup to get from there. Cowheel had way too much fat on it and tasted like it was not cleaned properly by the cook before being put in the darn soup, and the flavors were way off. I‚Äôm sorry, I can't eat here anymore.

I came here to get some Guyanese food for  my friends to try, since it was their first time eating Guyanese food. As a Guyanese person I am very embarrassed and very   disappointed with the food that I received. The jerk chicken was super salty I couldn't even eat it. It was horrible ü§Æ I had to throw it in the garbage. The chow mein was bland and over cooked üò´. The BBQ chicken was edible but the beef patties didn't have any taste. We also had to throw that away. The cheese rolls didn't have enough cheese in themü§∑üèæ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è. Like c'mon. Guyanese restaurants like this give us Guyanese people a bad name. When it comes to food only 4 Guyanese spots in the whole of Brooklyn so far that I've eaten from with good food are GT Paradise, Bamboo Garden, Linda's, and East Coast on Rogers in that order. When it comes to food, Guyanese restaurants never come up as a place people want to eat from. We have to do better and put people that can really cook good Guyanese food in the kitchen. I'm sorry for writing this long paragraph but I'm so upset üò° that I wasted my money on this food that I couldn't enjoy. SMH. This is my first and last time coming to this restaurant. It's a big L for me. P.S fire the chef!!!!!!!!!!!!!
I love love there üç≤ soup
Food is flavourful and delish
The food is always fresh and delicious!  Major compliments to the chef's.
Gt 2 d fullest
The people are so friendly,and the food is a A+.Every time I go to N.Y THATS MY FIRST STOP!!!!!

The person working today for Labor Day need a course in manners. She is very rude and disrespectful. Stop to check her message on her watch and when the line is long. We tap to let her know come on and she rudely said you better stop tapping. We end up riding out. I don‚Äôt spend my money with bad serve.

This place is as local as it gets. You can find a sense of family as it seems like everyone knows everyone. It's like an episode of cheers. This place combines love food family and friendships locally and abroad. Come in eat some food and relax. Your home away from home.
Ppl were rushing for food
The food and service was TOP notch. If you are looking for delicious authentic Guyanese food, this place is hard to beat!
Great food. Good music.

The service needs upped and the staff need to get rid of that rumshop style idea as well as make this place a place welcoming , very good food I must say there's a variety of Caribbean dishes, too expensive over the last 3 years they've‚Ä¶

My sister took me to this spot and now I'm hooked. I live in Manhattan but everytime I'm in Brookyn I go there. The music is great, it's free to get in, and the drinks are strong. They also have a spacious backyard which is a plus.

They just recently turned this spot into a full restuarant it was mostly known as a Guyanese hangout but the Pandemic made all that not possible anymore & I must say I been really impressed by there service, food & there different healthy‚Ä¶

I love that place . Good vibes , great food, lovely staff. I recommend anyone to come join the fun promise you will love everything about this great place.

Was here for a fundraiser for Dimple Willabus. It was clean and huge. Food taste great. Totally recommend this place.
